item.name: Surgeon Sign your Site Nursing Department Confirm
Patient UHID/IP Number & band numbers identification
Contact lenses / Glasses removed and in safe keeping
Blood Requirement (Type & Cross Match Units / Screem / Hold Blood Ready)
Sign in (Period before induction of anaesthesia)
Patient has confirmed. (Identity / site / Procedure / Consent)
Anaesthesia Safety Check Completed. (Anaesthesia Equipment / ABCDE)
Pulse Oxymeter on Patient and functioning
Risk of > 500 ml Blood lose (7 ml/kg in children)
item.yes: Yes, and adequate I.V. access & Blood/Fluids Planned.

item.name: Time Out (Period after induction & before surgical incision)
Confirm all team members have introduced themselves by name & role
Surgeon, Anaesthesis & Nurse verbally confirm (Patient / Site / Procedure)
Surgeons reviews: What are the critical or unexcepted steps, operative duration & anticipated blood loss.
Anaesthetist reviews: Are there any patient specific concerns
Nursing Team reviews: Has sterility been confirmed? Is there equipment issue or any concern ?
Has Antibiotic prophylaxis been given with in the last 60 minutes?
Sign Out (Period from wound closure bill transfer of the patient from OT Room)
Nurse Verbally Confirm with the team
The name of the procedure recorded
That instrument, sponge, needle counts are correct(or not applicable)
How the specimen is labelled (included patient name)
Whether there are any equipment problems to be addressed ?
Surgeon, Aneasthetist & Nurse review the key concerns fro recovery and management of patient & post-op orders to be given accordingly.
Information to patients attendants about procedure performed, condition of the patient & specimen to be shown.
Histopathology form to be filled properly.
Mallampatti Score, I, II, III, IV
ASA Grading I,II, III, IV, V
High risk / Moderate risk/ Low risk
Any Major discrepancy between PRE OP & POST - OP Diagnosis
Specimen to be sent to Histopathology
Condition of the Patient at end of Surgery
Routinely check he following every 5 to 10 minutes
RECOVERY SCORE : Ideally the patient should be discharged when total score is 10.

row.OT11-7-5: Arousable but drifts back to sleep

item.name: Patient's Score on Admission to Reovery
Patient receiving regional anaesthesia should also show signs of resolution of both sensory and motor blockade

row.OT11-15-1: Ventilation for most of the time fighting ventilator
